bill_title: require certain legislative meetings to be open to the public.

bill_versions.bill_text: FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to require certain legislative meetings to be open to the public. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. That chapter 1-25 be amended by adding a NEW SECTION to read: Any gathering of a simple majority of either the South Dakota House of Representatives or the South Dakota Senate, meeting to discuss introduced legislation, shall be open to the public. If a complaint alleging a violation of chapter 1-25 is made pursuant to § 23A-2-1, the attorney general shall take one of the following actions: (1) Prosecute the case under title 23A; (2) Determine that there is no merit to prosecuting the case. Upon doing so, the attorney general shall retain a copy of the complaint and any investigation file and shall use the information for statistical purposes and may publish abstracts of the information; or (3) Send the complaint and any investigation file to the South Dakota Open Meetings Commission for further action. 100 copies were printed on recycled paper by the South Dakota Legislative Research Council at a cost of $.167 per page. . Insertions into existing statutes are indicated by underscores. Deletions from existing statutes are indicated by overstrikes.

action_log.status_text: First read in Senate and referred to
